docs.text: Nettopologie Dataproduct This data product for EnergyHubs describes which information and data to exchange between DSO and customer/advisor when establishing an EnergyHub. A minimum set of data is defined that all operators are expected to conform to, along with a number of optional properties and data types. The data is intended to be presented as a hierarchy with a TopologyDataSet at its root, then TopologicalIsland-s nested inside the TopologyDataSet. A grid connection ( Aansluiting ) is defined as a UsagePoint and related to the classDiagram direction TB class TopologyDataSet { string identifier string contact_point string conforms_to date release_date string version string topological_islands } class TopologicalIsland { string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class TopologicalNode { SvVoltage sv_voltage TopologicalIsland topological_island BaseVoltage base_voltage ConnectivityNode connectivity_nodes } class SvVoltage { AngleDegrees angle Voltage v } class SvPowerFlow { ActivePower p ReactivePower q Terminal terminal } class Terminal { ConductingEquipment conducting_equipment ConnectivityNode connectivity_node integer sequence_number string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class UsagePoint { string connection_category UsagePointConnectedKind connection_state string disconnection_method CurrentFlow estimated_load boolean grounded boolean is_sdp boolean is_virtual Voltage nominal_service_voltage CurrentFlow rated_current ActivePower rated_power Equipment equipments string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class EnergyConsumer { ActivePower pfixed PerCent pfixed_pct ReactivePower qfixed PerCent qfixed_pct BaseVoltage base_voltage boolean aggregate boolean in_service boolean network_analysis_enabled boolean normally_in_service string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class EnergySource { BaseVoltage base_voltage boolean aggregate boolean in_service boolean network_analysis_enabled boolean normally_in_service string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } SvPowerFlow --> Terminal : terminal TopologyDataSet --> TopologicalIsland : topological_islands TopologicalNode --> SvVoltage : sv_voltage TopologicalNode --> TopologicalIsland : topological_island TopologicalNode --> ConnectivityNode : connectivity_nodes Terminal --> ConnectivityNode : connectivity_node Terminal --> EnergyConsumer : conducting_equipment Terminal --> EnergySource : conducting_equipment UsagePoint --> EnergyConsumer : equipments UsagePoint --> EnergySource : equipments Additional schemas JSON Schema Identifiers URI: Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage domain_of : - TopologicalNode - ConductingEquipment range : BaseVoltage required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:ConductingEquipment Induced name : ConductingEquipment description : The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that are conductively connected through terminals. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : Equipment attributes : base_voltage : name : base_voltage description : Base voltage of this conducting equipment. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage alias : base_voltage owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - TopologicalNode - ConductingEquipment range : BaseVoltage required : false multivalued : false aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \r\nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false in_service : name : in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.inService alias : in_service owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false network_analysis_enabled : name : network_analysis_enabled description : The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis. If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled alias : network_analysis_enabled owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normally_in_service owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : 'Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : true multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For example, not used for transformers. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage alias : base_voltage owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - TopologicalNode - ConductingEquipment range : BaseVoltage required : false multivalued : false aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \r\nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false in_service : name : in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.inService alias : in_service owner : ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false network_analysis_enabled : name : network_analysis_enabled description : The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis. Use only when there is no voltage level container used and only one base voltage applies. For example, not used for transformers. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:ConductingEquipment.BaseVoltage alias : base_voltage owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - TopologicalNode - ConductingEquipment range : BaseVoltage required : false multivalued : false aggregate : name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an\ \ aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \r\nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false in_service : name : in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.inService alias : in_service owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false network_analysis_enabled : name : network_analysis_enabled description : The equipment is enabled to participate in network analysis. If unspecified, the value is assumed to be true. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.networkAnalysisEnabled alias : network_analysis_enabled owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false normally_in_service : name : normally_in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment under normal operating conditions. True means the equipment is available for topology processing, which determines if the equipment is energized or not. False means that the equipment is treated by network applications as if it is not in the model. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.normallyInService alias : normally_in_service owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : 'Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : true multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.description alias : description owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false energy_ident_code_eic : name : energy_ident_code_eic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic alias : energy_ident_code_eic owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false european_article_number_ean : name : european_article_number_ean description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EAN code (European Article Number). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EAN code. For details on EAN scheme please refer to the [Codebesluit toekenning EAN-codes elektriciteit](https://www.acm.nl/nl/publicaties/codebesluit-toekenning-ean-codes-elektriciteit). from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : nl:IdentifiedObject.europeanArticleNumberEAN alias : european_article_number_ean owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this identified object. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.Names alias : names owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true short_name : name : short_name description : The attribute is used for an exchange of a human readable short name with length of the string 12 characters maximum. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.shortName alias : short_name owner : EnergyConnection domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:EnergyConnection

It is applicable in cases when the dedicated\ \ classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary\ \ to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true”\ \ the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that\ \ have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network\ \ reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines\ \ operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or\ \ aggregate synchronous machine. \r\nThe attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch,\ \ EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false in_service : name : in_service description : Specifies the availability of the equipment. docs.text:
Class: NameType _Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14. The definition from CIM14 is: _ _The localName is a human readable name of the object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation, VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have names that typically are unique among them. _ __ URI: cim:NameType classDiagram class NameType click NameType href "../NameType" NameType : description NameType : name_type_authority NameType --> "0..1" NameTypeAuthority : name_type_authority click NameTypeAuthority href "../NameTypeAuthority" NameType : names NameType --> "*" Name : names click Name href "../Name" Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance description 0..1 String Description of the name type direct name_type_authority 0..1 NameTypeAuthority Authority responsible for managing names of this type direct names * Name All names of this type direct Usages used by used in type used Name name_type range NameType NameTypeAuthority name_types range NameType Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:NameType native this:NameType LinkML Source Direct name : NameType description : "Type of name. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation,\ \ VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have\ \ names that typically are unique among them.

name : NameType description : "Type of name. Possible values for attribute 'name' are implementation\ \ dependent but standard profiles may specify types. An enterprise may have multiple\ \ IT systems each having its own local name for the same object, e.g. a planning\ \ system may have different names from an EMS. An object may also have different\ \ names within the same IT system, e.g. localName as defined in CIM version 14.\ \ The definition from CIM14 is:
The localName is a human readable name of the\ \ object. It is a free text name local to a node in a naming hierarchy similar to\ \ a file directory structure. A power system related naming hierarchy may be: Substation,\ \ VoltageLevel, Equipment etc. Children of the same parent in such a hierarchy have\ \ names that typically are unique among them.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 attributes : description : name : description description : "Description of the name type.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:NameType.description domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false name_type_authority : name : name_type_authority description : Authority responsible for managing names of this type. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:NameType.NameTypeAuthority domain_of : - NameType range : NameTypeAuthority required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this type. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 slot_uri : cim:NameType.Names domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true class_uri : cim:NameType

docs.text: NettopologieDataproduct This data product for EnergyHubs describes which information and data to exchange between DSO and customer/advisor when establishing an EnergyHub. A minimum set of data is defined that all operators are expected to conform to, along with a number of optional properties and data types. The data is intended to be presented as a hierarchy with a TopologyDataSet at its root, then TopologicalIsland-s nested inside the TopologyDataSet. A grid connection ( Aansluiting ) is defined as a UsagePoint and related to the classDiagram direction TB class TopologyDataSet { string identifier string contact_point string conforms_to date release_date string version string topological_islands } class TopologicalIsland { string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class TopologicalNode { SvVoltage sv_voltage TopologicalIsland topological_island BaseVoltage base_voltage ConnectivityNode connectivity_nodes } class SvVoltage { AngleDegrees angle Voltage v } class SvPowerFlow { ActivePower p ReactivePower q Terminal terminal } class Terminal { ConductingEquipment conducting_equipment ConnectivityNode connectivity_node integer sequence_number string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class UsagePoint { string connection_category UsagePointConnectedKind connection_state string disconnection_method CurrentFlow estimated_load boolean grounded boolean is_sdp boolean is_virtual Voltage nominal_service_voltage CurrentFlow rated_current ActivePower rated_power Equipment equipments string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class EnergyConsumer { ActivePower pfixed PerCent pfixed_pct ReactivePower qfixed PerCent qfixed_pct BaseVoltage base_voltage boolean aggregate boolean in_service boolean network_analysis_enabled boolean normally_in_service string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } class EnergySource { BaseVoltage base_voltage boolean aggregate boolean in_service boolean network_analysis_enabled boolean normally_in_service string m_rid string description string energy_ident_code_eic string european_article_number_ean Name names string short_name } SvPowerFlow --> Terminal : terminal TopologyDataSet --> TopologicalIsland : topological_islands TopologicalNode --> SvVoltage : sv_voltage TopologicalNode --> TopologicalIsland : topological_island TopologicalNode --> ConnectivityNode : connectivity_nodes Terminal --> ConnectivityNode : connectivity_node Terminal --> EnergyConsumer : conducting_equipment Terminal --> EnergySource : conducting_equipment UsagePoint --> EnergyConsumer : equipments UsagePoint --> EnergySource : equipments Additional schemas JSON Schema Identifiers URI: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0

docs.text: Enum: PhaseCode _An unordered enumeration of phase identifiers. Allows designation of phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads. The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together or connected to ground. Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase. _ _Residential and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase, secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A, B, C phase codes instead of s12N. _ The integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to support revenue metering applications. Allows designation of\ \ phases for both transmission and distribution equipment, circuits and loads. \ \ The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together\ \ or connected to ground. Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase.\r\nResidential\ \ and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase,\ \ secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires\ \ that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through\ \ single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from\ \ one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A,\ \ B, C phase codes instead of s12N.\r\nThe integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to\ \ support revenue metering applications." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 enum_uri : cim:PhaseCode permissible_values : A : text : A meaning : cim:PhaseCode.A AB : text : AB meaning : cim:PhaseCode.AB ABC : text : ABC meaning : cim:PhaseCode.ABC ABCN : text : ABCN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.ABCN ABN : text : ABN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.ABN AC : text : AC meaning : cim:PhaseCode.AC ACN : text : ACN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.ACN AN : text : AN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.AN B : text : B meaning : cim:PhaseCode.B BC : text : BC meaning : cim:PhaseCode.BC BCN : text : BCN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.BCN BN : text : BN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.BN C : text : C meaning : cim:PhaseCode.C CN : text : CN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.CN N : text : N meaning : cim:PhaseCode.N none : text : none meaning : cim:PhaseCode.none s1 : text : s1 meaning : cim:PhaseCode.s1 s12 : text : s12 meaning : cim:PhaseCode.s12 s12N : text : s12N meaning : cim:PhaseCode.s12N s1N : text : s1N meaning : cim:PhaseCode.s1N s2 : text : s2 meaning : cim:PhaseCode.s2 s2N : text : s2N meaning : cim:PhaseCode.s2N X : text : X meaning : cim:PhaseCode.X XN : text : XN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.XN XY : text : XY meaning : cim:PhaseCode.XY XYN : text : XYN meaning : cim:PhaseCode.XYN

The enumeration, by itself, does not describe how the phases are connected together or connected to ground. Ground is not explicitly denoted as a phase. _ _Residential and small commercial loads are often served from single-phase, or split-phase, secondary circuits. For the example of s12N, phases 1 and 2 refer to hot wires that are 180 degrees out of phase, while N refers to the neutral wire. Through single-phase transformer connections, these secondary circuits may be served from one or two of the primary phases A, B, and C. For three-phase loads, use the A, B, C phase codes instead of s12N. _ The integer values are from IEC 61968-9 to support revenue metering applications. URI: PhaseCode

docs.text: name : SvPowerFlow description : State variable for power flow. Load convention is used for flow direction. This means flow out from the TopologicalNode into the equipment is positive. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 attributes : p : name : p description : The active power flow. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:SvPowerFlow.p domain_of : - SvPowerFlow range : ActivePower required : true multivalued : false q : name : q description : The reactive power flow. Load sign convention is used, i.e. positive sign means flow out from a TopologicalNode (bus) into the conducting equipment. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:SvPowerFlow.q domain_of : - SvPowerFlow range : ReactivePower required : true multivalued : false terminal : name : terminal description : The terminal associated with the power flow state variable. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:SvPowerFlow.Terminal domain_of : - SvPowerFlow range : Terminal required : true multivalued : false class_uri : cim:SvPowerFlow

Conducting equipment have terminals that may be connected to other conducting equipment terminals via connectivity nodes or topological nodes. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Terminal.ConductingEquipment domain_of : - Terminal - BaseVoltage range : ConductingEquipment required : true multivalued : false connectivity_node : name : connectivity_node description : The connectivity node to which this terminal connects with zero impedance. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Terminal.ConnectivityNode domain_of : - Terminal range : ConnectivityNode required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:Terminal Induced name : Terminal description : An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment. The sequence numbering starts with 1 and additional terminals should follow in increasing order. The first terminal is the "starting point" for a two terminal branch. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:ACDCTerminal.sequenceNumber alias : sequence_number owner : Terminal domain_of : - ACDCTerminal range : integer required : true multivalued : false m_rid : name : m_rid description : 'Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : Terminal domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : true multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. It may be non unique and may not correlate to a naming hierarchy. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.description alias : description owner : Terminal domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType - NameTypeAuthority range : string required : false multivalued : false energy_ident_code_eic : name : energy_ident_code_eic description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EIC code (Energy identification Code). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EIC code. For details on EIC scheme please refer to ENTSO-E web site. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.energyIdentCodeEic alias : energy_ident_code_eic owner : Terminal domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false european_article_number_ean : name : european_article_number_ean description : The attribute is used for an exchange of the EAN code (European Article Number). The length of the string is 16 characters as defined by the EAN code. For details on EAN scheme please refer to the [Codebesluit toekenning EAN-codes elektriciteit](https://www.acm.nl/nl/publicaties/codebesluit-toekenning-ean-codes-elektriciteit). from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : nl:IdentifiedObject.europeanArticleNumberEAN alias : european_article_number_ean owner : Terminal domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false names : name : names description : All names of this identified object. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.Names alias : names owner : Terminal domain_of : - IdentifiedObject - NameType range : Name required : false multivalued : true short_name : name : short_name description : The attribute is used for an exchange of a human readable short name with length of the string 12 characters maximum. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : eu:IdentifiedObject.shortName alias : short_name owner : Terminal domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : false multivalued : false class_uri : cim:Terminal

docs.text:
Class: TopologicalIsland _An electrically connected subset of the network. Topological islands can change as the current network state changes, e.g. due to: _ - disconnect switches or breakers changing state in a SCADA/EMS. - manual creation, change or deletion of topological nodes in a planning tool. Only energised TopologicalNode-s shall be part of the topological island. docs.title: Class: TopologicalIsland

docs.text: _An electrically connected subset of the network. Topological islands can change as the current network state changes, e.g. due to: _ - disconnect switches or breakers changing state in a SCADA/EMS. - manual creation, change or deletion of topological nodes in a planning tool. Only energised TopologicalNode-s shall be part of the topological island. docs.title: Induced

docs.text: Class: TopologicalNode For a detailed substation model a topological node is a set of connectivity nodes that, in the current network state, are connected together through any type of closed switches, including jumpers. Topological nodes change as the current network state changes (i.e., switches, breakers, etc. change state). For a planning model, switch statuses are not used to form topological nodes. Instead they are manually created or deleted in a model builder tool. Topological nodes maintained this way are also called "busses". URI: cim:TopologicalNode classDiagram class TopologicalNode click TopologicalNode href "../TopologicalNode" TopologicalNode : base_voltage TopologicalNode --> "1" BaseVoltage : base_voltage click BaseVoltage href "../BaseVoltage" TopologicalNode : connectivity_nodes TopologicalNode --> "*" ConnectivityNode : connectivity_nodes click ConnectivityNode href "../ConnectivityNode" TopologicalNode : sv_voltage TopologicalNode --> "0..1" SvVoltage : sv_voltage click SvVoltage href "../SvVoltage" TopologicalNode : topological_island TopologicalNode --> "0..1" TopologicalIsland : topological_island click TopologicalIsland href "../TopologicalIsland" Slots Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance sv_voltage 0..1 SvVoltage The state voltage associated with the topological node direct topological_island 0..1 TopologicalIsland A topological node belongs to a topological island direct base_voltage 1 BaseVoltage The base voltage of the topological node direct connectivity_nodes * ConnectivityNode The connectivity nodes combine together to form this topological node direct Usages used by used in type used BaseVoltage topological_node range TopologicalNode Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:TopologicalNode native this:TopologicalNode LinkML Source Direct name : TopologicalNode description : 'For a detailed substation model a topological node is a set of connectivity nodes that, in the current network state, are connected together through any type of closed switches, including jumpers. Instead they are manually created or deleted in a model builder tool. Class: UsagePoint Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be attributed. Used at the place where a physical or virtual meter may be located; however, it is not required that a meter be present. " from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionState domain_of : - UsagePoint range : UsagePointConnectedKind required : false multivalued : false disconnection_method : name : disconnection_method description : Is an indication of how the usage point is physically connected or disconnected. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.disconnectionMethod domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false estimated_load : name : estimated_load description : Estimated load. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.estimatedLoad domain_of : - UsagePoint range : CurrentFlow required : false multivalued : false grounded : name : grounded description : True if grounded. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.grounded domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false is_sdp : name : is_sdp description : "If true, this usage point is a service delivery point, i.e., a usage\ \ point where the ownership of the service changes hands.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isSdp domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false is_virtual : name : is_virtual description : If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isVirtual domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false nominal_service_voltage : name : nominal_service_voltage description : "Nominal service voltage.

The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : UsagePoint domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : true multivalued : false description : name : description description : The description is a free human readable text describing or naming the object. name : UsagePoint description : Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be attributed. Used at the place where a physical or virtual meter may be located; however, it is not required that a meter be present. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 is_a : IdentifiedObject attributes : connection_category : name : connection_category description : A code used to specify the connection category, e.g., low voltage or low pressure, where the usage point is defined. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionCategory domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false connection_state : name : connection_state description : "State of the usage point with respect to connection to the network.\ 
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.connectionState domain_of : - UsagePoint range : UsagePointConnectedKind required : false multivalued : false disconnection_method : name : disconnection_method description : Is an indication of how the usage point is physically connected or disconnected. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.disconnectionMethod domain_of : - UsagePoint range : string required : false multivalued : false estimated_load : name : estimated_load description : Estimated load. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.estimatedLoad domain_of : - UsagePoint range : CurrentFlow required : false multivalued : false grounded : name : grounded description : True if grounded. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.grounded domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false is_sdp : name : is_sdp description : "If true, this usage point is a service delivery point, i.e., a usage\ \ point where the ownership of the service changes hands.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isSdp domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false is_virtual : name : is_virtual description : If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.isVirtual domain_of : - UsagePoint range : boolean required : false multivalued : false nominal_service_voltage : name : nominal_service_voltage description : "Nominal service voltage.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.nominalServiceVoltage domain_of : - UsagePoint range : Voltage required : false multivalued : false rated_current : name : rated_current description : "Current flow that this usage point is configured to deliver.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.ratedCurrent domain_of : - UsagePoint range : CurrentFlow required : false multivalued : false rated_power : name : rated_power description : "Active power that this usage point is configured to deliver.
" from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.ratedPower domain_of : - UsagePoint range : ActivePower required : false multivalued : false equipments : name : equipments description : All equipment connecting this usage point to the electrical grid. from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:UsagePoint.Equipments domain_of : - UsagePoint range : Equipment required : false multivalued : true class_uri : cim:UsagePoint

docs.text: Slot: aggregate The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection. URI: cim:Equipment.aggregate Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot EnergyConsumer Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model no ConductingEquipment The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that a... no Equipment The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanic... no EnergySource A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution... no EnergyConnection A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model no Properties Range: Boolean Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:Equipment.aggregate native this:aggregate LinkML Source name : aggregate description : "The aggregate flag provides an alternative way of representing an aggregated\ \ (equivalent) element. It is applicable in cases when the dedicated classes for\ \ equivalent equipment do not have all of the attributes necessary to represent\ \ the required level of detail. In case the flag is set to “true” the single instance\ \ of equipment represents multiple pieces of equipment that have been modelled together\ \ as an aggregate equivalent obtained by a network reduction procedure. Examples\ \ would be power transformers or synchronous machines operating in parallel modelled\ \ as a single aggregate power transformer or aggregate synchronous machine. \r\n\ The attribute is not used for EquivalentBranch, EquivalentShunt and EquivalentInjection." from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:Equipment.aggregate alias : aggregate owner : Equipment domain_of : - Equipment range : boolean required : false multivalued : false

docs.text: Slot: is_virtual If true, this usage point is virtual, i.e., no physical location exists in the network where a meter could be located to collect the meter readings. For example, one may define a virtual usage point to serve as an aggregation of usage for all of a company's premises distributed widely across the distribution territory. Otherwise, the usage point is physical, i.e., there is a logical point in the network where a meter could be located to collect meter readings. docs.text: Slot: m_rid Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements. URI: cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID Applicable Classes Name Description Modifies Slot TopologicalIsland An electrically connected subset of the network no EnergyConsumer Generic user of energy - a point of consumption on the power system model no IdentifiedObject This is a root class to provide common identification for all classes needing... no ACDCTerminal An electrical connection point (AC or DC) to a piece of conducting equipment no PowerSystemResource A power system resource (PSR) can be an item of equipment such as a switch, a... no ConductingEquipment The parts of the AC power system that are designed to carry current or that a... no UsagePoint Logical or physical point in the network to which readings or events may be a... no Terminal An AC electrical connection point to a piece of conducting equipment no Equipment The parts of a power system that are physical devices, electronic or mechanic... no EnergySource A generic equivalent for an energy supplier on a transmission or distribution... no EnergyConnection A connection of energy generation or consumption on the power system model no Properties Range: String Required: True Identifier and Mapping Information Schema Source from schema: http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 Mappings Mapping Type Mapped Value self cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID native this:m_rid LinkML Source name : m_rid description : 'Master resource identifier issued by a model authority. The mRID is unique within an exchange context. Global uniqueness is easily achieved by using a UUID, as specified in RFC 4122, for the mRID. The use of UUID is strongly recommended. For CIMXML data files in RDF syntax conforming to IEC 61970-552, the mRID is mapped to rdf:ID or rdf:about attributes that identify CIM object elements.' from_schema : http://data.netbeheernederland.nl/dp-eh-nettopologie/version#1.0.0 rank : 1000 slot_uri : cim:IdentifiedObject.mRID alias : m_rid owner : IdentifiedObject domain_of : - IdentifiedObject range : string required : true multivalued : false
